intro: Racosperma cedroides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf acacia, is a shrub or small tree native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant has bipinnate leaves that are often narrow and arranged in a feathery pattern. It produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense spikes, which attract pollinators like bees and birds. Racosperma cedroides is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions.
